column1: Today is Small Businesses Saturday! Remember to #ShopSmall and support the outstanding small businesses across Collin County. Here are a few ways you can show your support: ➡️ Shop Online ➡️ Order Takeout ➡️ Purchase Gift Cards https://t.co/t6ygZN9k4f
This year has brought many challenges but as Americans we have so much to be thankful for. Happy Thanksgiving to you and your loved ones! https://t.co/bvAhrSBF0h

Sent a letter w/ @RepJimmyPanetta urging the NPRC to process record requests. While this pandemic has presented many challenges just as families and businesses have worked to overcome these hardships federal agencies must adapt to continue serving the American people. https://t.co/EcmEG7KtM8

Happy #NationalAdoptionDay to the many families across North Texas who’ve experienced the blessing of adoption! Click the link for resources and to learn more about the adoption process in Texas: https://t.co/whqzA04HQK https://t.co/FRX10mpX0h

Enjoy seeing the next generation of leaders learn more about democracy and our legislative process. Proud of @PWSHWolves Pranav Pattatathunaduvil Angela Wang and Tejas Bansal for placing 1st 2nd and 3rd in this year’s @UILTexas Congress Regional Contest! Congratulations! https://t.co/P8QCwD7VAd

Thanks for having me Mel! Click below watch our interview and learn more about the different resources available through my office as well as my plans for serving Collin County during the 117th Congress! https://t.co/autMe3wN4a
The @USMC celebrated their 245th birthday last week and today surprised me with a cake baked this morning at the Barracks in DC! #HappyBirthdayMarines https://t.co/Wv0mfkAbJv

Invictus Relief founder Dr. Eric Berg and his team are working nonstop to support our most vulnerable populations during the pandemic. This #HometownHero provided PPE and other resources to over 25 nursing homes & assisted living facilities in Collin County! Thank you Dr. Berg! https://t.co/0E71RDYBma

Congratulations to Mr. Victor Glover of Prosper as his son @AstroVicGlover became the first Black astronaut to start a long-term stay on the @Space_Station this week. We are proud to have your family in Collin County and are wishing your son safe travels! https://t.co/Bir3d3ZPkj

Our local small businesses have a huge impact not only on the individuals they employ but the communities they serve. Thankful my office was able to help Primrose School of Plano acquire the financial relief needed to continue teaching students during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/PTE3tgN2xf
Wishing all a happy and prosperous Diwali! May the light of the diyas guide you in the coming year! https://t.co/EbVYEKkI90

This November as we commemorate #HomeCareHospiceMonth join me in honoring the many nurses therapists and home care aides serving our community. I’m very proud of those who're caring for our vulnerable neighbors especially during the COIVD-19 pandemic. https://t.co/zBcdw5hmiI

Honored to join community leaders and the @McKinneyChamber for the ribbon cutting and celebration of @ATTByronNelson’s move to @TPCCraigRanch. Collin County is proud to host this tournament and looking forward to the many opportunities it will provide our local economy! https://t.co/pfdhnk8Cx0
What an incredible privilege to have served with @USMC Charlie Co. 4th Recon. Happy #VeteransDay to the bravest men I know. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/ualmjPyqyM
Proud to wish my fellow @USMC a happy 245th birthday! Semper Fi Marines! https://t.co/SkL5Is9l1r
The @USMC has been defending the freedoms of Americans for 245 years and I’m very proud to have served alongside so many courageous men and women. #HappyBirthdayMarines https://t.co/avnD7MrmKW

Thanks to #OperationWarpSpeed & scientists researchers & clinical trial participants Pfizer announced their #COVID19 vaccine has proven to be 90% effective. As a result of this private/public partnership Americans will have access to 100 mil doses once approved by @US_FDA. https://t.co/bZxsIjudxV

Excited to have joined with the @QorvoInc team in Richardson for the big announcement of their DoD contract to establish advanced semiconductor packaging capabilities in the US. Looking forward to the new jobs and economic growth this program will create in our community. https://t.co/teab0WozMB

In Texas our elections are carried out with speed and transparency with both Republican and Democrat poll watchers involved in the ballot counting process.  Allegations of irregularity in the counting of certain ballots and overt censorship are concerning and must be addressed: https://t.co/9ft9k9ViDo

Proud to present Plano’s very own Blake Coleman with a flag that was flown over our nation’s Capitol in honor of Blake Coleman Day. As the first native Texan to win the @StanleyCup our community is filled with pride to celebrate this amazing athlete! https://t.co/7e67SS7wPz

Reminder: the deadline to submit an application for a U.S. Service Academy Nomination is fast approaching! Interested students should return their completed packet to my office no later than Friday November 13th by 5pm. For questions please contact my office at (972) 202-4150. https://t.co/56UgeP5o5A
Same goes for Texans. https://t.co/P5abYxC5gd

Collin County law enforcement officers firefighters paramedics and other first responders run TOWARDS danger to help their neighbor. Today on #FirstRespondersAppreciationDay we thank them for selflessness as they work to keep our communities safe. https://t.co/ZspzY3cUC5

As we work to safely reopen our economy I’m proud to fight on behalf of Collin County small businesses to ensure they receive the relief needed to continue operating. If you are a local small business owner please do not hesitate to contact my office at (972) 202-4150 for help. https://t.co/a7DTwwfO3I

Yesterday I visited with the Frisco Sunrise Rotary about their ongoing humanitarian work and the ways I’m working on their behalf in Congress. I’m constantly impressed by the role our local rotaries play in strengthening our community especially during a global pandemic. https://t.co/NOhKIyfvzm

Pranav Pattatathunaduvil and his team of students at Be the Light Youth are using the money they’ve fundraised through speech and debate events and donating it to local food pantries in need during #COVID19. Thanks Pranav for showing us what it means to be a #HometownHero! https://t.co/v2jjO5o6G4

This past weekend my Congressional Youth Advisory Council met with several different leaders with diverse backgrounds to learn more about the impact of COVID-19. I continue to be impressed with the engagement of these dynamic students. https://t.co/DXtgLReLrL

Since the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic I’ve been working for people across Collin County like Beth’s son to make sure they receive their benefits. If you are needing help with a federal agency please contact my office at (972) 202-4150 so we can help in any way we can. https://t.co/OEQusVwQt5

Proud to receive the Guardian of Small Business Award from @NFIB especially during a time when our local businesses need more support than ever. I will continue to fight for #TX03 small businesses as we work together to carefully reopen and restore our economy. https://t.co/gLNkSbwcS1

This week I continued my fight to protect children from forced marriages. @RepGwenMoore and I introduced legislation to study state laws on child marriages and help keep all children safe. Read more here ⤵ https://t.co/NaU2xvkNTK

Thank you to @ChaseOaks Church for launching #HereForGood which is spreading hope throughout our neighborhoods and addressing critical issues like food insecurity during the COVID-19 pandemic. These #HometownHeroes are working to ensure no one is left behind. https://t.co/JYmc9Hnxev

Collin County is home to over 90 hotels that employ thousands of workers. During my visit to Staybridge Suites of Plano we discussed the importance of federal support for the hospitality industry so they can continue bringing jobs to our local economy and serving our community. https://t.co/9DJ3ncJbzR

Families workers and small businesses across the country are hurting and need relief now. Republicans and Democrats must put aside partisan differences and instead come together to do what's best for the American people. https://t.co/JGysLp9BMi

Like Mi many have found themselves struggling with state & federal agencies at a time when every day waiting means increased stressed & uncertainty.  If you need assistance navigating a federal agency or TWC please reach out to my office at (972) 202-4150. https://t.co/1pnyu1VAun

What a privilege it was to help Girl Scout Troop 2126 of Richardson earn their Democracy Badge tonight. We discussed the three branches of government and the legacy of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. https://t.co/nMrRojaYe2

Advocating for mental health is especially important during these times of increased isolation. @PSHSWildcats student Arbaaz Karim founded The World is Yours Studios where he combines innovation & fashion to increase suicide awareness. This #TX03 #HometownHero is changing lives! https://t.co/AHBNNMIjGc

Proud to see the winning piece from this year’s #TX03 Congressional Art Competition “Aged to Perfection” by Rhea Sood representing Collin County in the halls of the United States Capitol! Congrats again Rhea! https://t.co/gsjuwWHtu9

Starting a new school is no easy venture especially during this pandemic. Excited for Pinnacle Montessori of Melissa to open its doors and begin teaching and inspiring young minds in our community! https://t.co/oiFQqf4nEZ

Congrats to Anika Chebrolu from @FriscoISD for being named America’s Top #YoungScientist of 2020 by @3M! This inspiring 9th grader is seeking to better the lives of those around her by developing a more effective flu treatment. Keep up the good work Anika! https://t.co/Th4X5OVI2I

Hometown heroes @ScrubsSupport has been working hard to keep our dedicated healthcare professionals fueled - delivering hot meals from local restaurants to healthcare workers on the frontlines. We are truly blessed to have such compassionate neighbors. https://t.co/jYZep7g98d

Enjoyed touring the Scottish Rite for Children facility in Frisco and learning more about the outstanding pediatric orthopedic services they provide to North Texas families. We are grateful for their dedication to ensuring every child has the opportunity to thrive. https://t.co/ZJdwNqE2qR

Congrats to Rhea Sood of Imagine International Academy of North Texas for winning the #TX03 2020 Congressional Art Competition! Rhea’s piece “Aged to Perfection” will be  displayed in our nation’s Capitol for the next year so others may admire her outstanding artistry. https://t.co/GrqZEdqqeO

As we recognize #BreastCancerAwarenessMonth this October let’s challenge ourselves to increase our knowledge of the disease celebrate those who have beat it and stand with those still fighting. https://t.co/4kcaS8CwG1

While I was in @CityOfMcKinney I made sure to grab lunch at @HugsCafe and see the amazing way founder Ruth Thompson is bettering the lives of adults with special needs. I’m glad my office was able to help this inspirational business keep their doors open during this pandemic. https://t.co/uQ56yYLcQZ

Don’t forget to register for my Virtual Service Academy Q&A taking place tonight from 6PM-7PM! Academy Representatives will be joining us to talk about this unique and esteemed educational opportunity. Click the link below to register! ⬇️  https://t.co/CEZ2rVD2bL

Thank you to #HometownHero & founder of @MinniesPantry Cheryl Jackson who has never stopped working to ensure North Texas families come home to a warm & healthy meal even throughout the pandemic. With over 14 millions meals served in the last decade we can’t thank you enough. https://t.co/qqGcOwo58T

COVID-19 has highlighted long-standing inconsistencies in the collection & reporting of health data at all levels of gov. Proud to be joined by @RepShalala to introduce H.R.8444  to help ensure health officials have access to the best info. & data. https://t.co/fqJKEQtcTq

Met with Boy Scout Troop 999 Plano to talk about the constitutional rights and civic responsibilities we have as Americans. As an Eagle Scout I’m very proud of how this organization is shaping our next generation of strong leaders and community servants. https://t.co/vAWnx0aSwD

Collin County Veterans face longer wait times & are forced to travel further distances to access VA medical care. Today I sent a letter to @SecWilkie requesting an increase of VA care facilities in #TX03. Our Veterans deserve better. INFO: https://t.co/gHlb0nQHwv https://t.co/ILSTeHswVs
Happy #VFWDay to our local posts and every veteran here in Collin County! Thank you for your brave service to our nation and your continued dedication to our community! https://t.co/nUMphrxnrk

While virtual meetings present their own challenges they do make it easier for more constituents to participate! Thanks to all 3 generations of the Anthony Family from Plano who requested a meeting to discuss the issues most important to them as part of my 100% Meeting Policy! https://t.co/79HWEN7fuS

I could not be more excited to introduce my 2020 Congressional Youth Advisory Council. These bright young people will lead their generation with their innovative minds and dedication to making a difference! https://t.co/xtLkZMJGce

Running a business is never an easy task let alone during a global pandemic. Recently I joined with small business owners in Melissa for some Sugar Babes Donuts and to discuss ways we can work together to restore our local economy. https://t.co/coLQcGfQQx
Wishing all those observing an easy fast and meaningful reflection this Yom Kippur.   G’mar Chatimah Tovah! https://t.co/u5p0cj1gjd

Helping Healthcare Heroes was started by two inspirational #HometownHeroes Amay Mehta & Sayooj Dinesan to thank healthcare workers in our community w/ cards gift bags & more. We're lucky to have these Imagine International Academy students helping support healthcare workers! https://t.co/eOkw1uMJey

Ensuring workers have the skills and knowledge to obtain jobs in our community is incredibly important especially given the economic setbacks of the COVID-19 pandemic. Thanks to @Toyota for your efforts to improve vocational education in #TX03! https://t.co/SClyjtJq1H

Next week I'll launch my Virtual U.S. Service Academies Information Portal for #TX03 students interested in Congressional Nominations. Portal will be live on Tuesday September 28 2020!  https://t.co/a9tH9drKTG

We weren’t elected to play political games gamble with people’s lives and then go home when negotiations get difficult. Congress should stay in Washington until a bipartisan agreement is reached. Families schools small business owners and workers cannot afford to wait. https://t.co/7raahnsT90

Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was an ambitious litigator a trailblazer and a dedicated public servant. She committed her life to justice and to our nation. Tonight her family and loved ones are in our prayers. https://t.co/1kRpJYHZBb

National #POWMIADay serves as an important reminder of the innumerable sacrifices prisoners of war those who are missing in action and their families have made so that we may live free. We can never thank them enough for their bravery and patriotism. https://t.co/gDTUjsycTw
Wishing all those celebrating a very happy #RoshHashana! May the New Year bring many blessings. https://t.co/TBx8fxCIbl

233 years ago on September 17 1787 the United States Constitution was signed in Philadelphia establishing our government as one existing to serve its citizens. In Congress I will continue to defend our liberty our rights and our constitution. Happy #ConstitutionDay! https://t.co/W75n0XcBUg

We have not forgotten the heroism displayed by Officer David Sherrard during his 13 years of service in the @RichardsonTX_PD. Join me in praying for the Sherrard family as our community honors his sacrifice tomorrow. https://t.co/EI844hurvH

Very proud of Judge @EmilyMiskel who will receive the William H. Rehnquist Award for Judicial Excellence for her efforts to innovate remote trials when the COVID-19 pandemic hit. Job well done!  https://t.co/PfUCKyFlXu

House Republicans have a plan to restore our way of life rebuild our economy and renew the American Dream. Visit https://t.co/DRapHQmJZU and learn how we’re working together to emerge from this pandemic stronger than ever before. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/IkTEuSiIIt

This month I met with small businesses and leaders in the @CityofAnna to discuss ways federal CARES Act funding is helping keep businesses open and providing support to employees impacted by #COVID19. There's much work to be done but we'll overcome this together. https://t.co/i5AUxmBT5X

Trevor Reed a former Marine and Texas native has been held in a Russian prison for over a year on baseless accusations. Today I joined other Texans in Congress in calling for the Putin Regime to #FreeTrevorReed and allow his safe return to the United States. https://t.co/2P8DMgM4Lq

Enjoyed visiting Acuity TMS of Plano and learning about their innovative treatments for depression and PTSD. I’m thankful my office was able to help keep their doors open during #COVID19 so our local veterans and others can continue receiving the healthcare they deserve. https://t.co/oixUfnvC9T

Today the world watched America lead the way towards establishing peace and prosperity in the Middle East with the signing of the #AbrahamAccords. Excited to watch this new historic chapter unfold. https://t.co/XldagoXwJ4
This should have happened months ago. Bipartisan solutions are there if Washington would just knock off the partisan political games. https://t.co/CrtoA32vm5

Thanks @AGFoodPantry for fighting hunger in our community and continuing to provide essential resources during #COVID19! These #HometownHeroes distribute over 30 tons of food every month to Collin County families. To nominate a local hero visit https://t.co/CYKM88NgEl! https://t.co/nBxfH3lyC7

I stopped by @PlanoFireRescue to thank our local heroes in front of this powerful mural as we remember today and every day the courageous sacrifices made 19 years ago by firefighters and so many other first responders on September 11th. #NeverForget https://t.co/S0yJsn7d36

On 9/11 I was serving my last day at the Anacostia Naval Annex. I was suppose to have lunch at the Pentagon but instead watched smoke rise across the Potomac. I swore to always work to make a difference & today I joined law enforcement in McKinney to remember that day. https://t.co/uz1gD4TRdi

Today as we reflect on the unshakeable solitude & strength of the American people I gathered with the @Town_of_Prosper & the @ProsperFireDept in front of a recovered beam from the Twin Towers as we honored those who lost their lives on that tragic day. #NeverForget https://t.co/zqMclgsZpz

Especially during these difficult times it’s important we remember to check in on neighbors and friends smile at strangers and connect with the people around us.   If you or someone you know is in crisis call 800-273-8255 for help. #WorldSuicidePreventionDay https://t.co/uNZXf0NRJ8

Excited to announce my office is now accepting entries for the Congressional App Challenge! This competition allows middle and high school students from #TX03 to show off their programming skills for a chance to be nationally recognized! Visit https://t.co/hjoJAuQ9Tc for info! https://t.co/I8Vkzr9HFB

The crucial role early childhood education plays in a child’s foundation cannot be overstated. Thank you to the team at @PrimroseSchools of Plano at Deerfield for showing me how they’re working to safely teach students during the pandemic. https://t.co/d8sFB9EYDD

Don't forget! There are only four days left for #TX03 high school students to apply for my Congressional Youth Advisory Council!  Applications are due by 5pm on Tuesday September 8th! Apply now! https://t.co/GHjPO5mzLf https://t.co/MUdnoK7nyW

Enjoyed learning more about how @FriscoYMCA is helping families in our community by providing a stable environment where kids can feel safe and supported as we adjust to new ways of learning. https://t.co/HWRcaAEuZo

It’s nice to see #HometownHeroes like @SROChristian who remind us there’re still reasons to smile even in hard times. This officer goes above & beyond his role to protect @Allen_ISD students helping to distribute crucial resources needed for new learning environments! Thank you! https://t.co/gDn9BRAYgN

Using funds from Congress @CollinCountyGov has launched the Collin CARES Small Business Grant Program to help local businesses rebound from the pandemic. More information including application and eligibility requirements can be found below: https://t.co/7K2lXrSjL4

The Census helps government officials at all levels make important planning decisions for health clinics highways fire departments disaster response and education programs right here in Collin County. Make sure to complete the #2020Census today at https://t.co/JUkMXSq4bV! https://t.co/i9AKnubgTe

Pranavi Reddi is a #HometownHero serving our community with her nonprofit Kindness4All. From hosting food donation drives to providing resources to those experiencing homelessness this young @Cen10titans leader is bringing hope to Collin County. Thank you Pranavi! https://t.co/v31RBMP3ll

In 1893 the first attempt to organize the women’s suffrage movement in Texas took place in Dallas. 20 yrs later the Lone Star State became the first in the south to ratify the 19th Amendment. Our nation could not thrive without strong and determined women. #WomensVote100 https://t.co/NIgljWpwvj

On this #NationalNonprofitDay I would like to highlight the outstanding work of the Collin County Homeless Coalition who I met with earlier this month. Thank you for your dedication to ending homelessness in our community. https://t.co/I1511ETqrw
Stay safe Collin County! https://t.co/zM01Igfw7p

Creators of Spreading Thanks Tanya Sayooj & Amoolya Tadepalli are proving there’s no age requirement to make a difference in your community. I’m humbled by these #HometownHeroes from Heritage HS who are showing appreciation to frontline workers with handmade thank you cards! https://t.co/olSF6Adx1n

My team and I have made the difficult decision to cancel the 2020 Congressional Veteran Commendation program. While this outcome is disappointing the health safety and well-being of our Veterans is always my first priority. https://t.co/VzO5xonTqB

Attention #TX03 high school students: If you’re interested in an opportunity to learn about government while strengthening your leadership skills there’s ONE MONTH left to apply for my Congressional Youth Advisory Council! Learn more: https://t.co/a0pgGcHmoD https://t.co/NS63ozcaby
This weekend is #TaxFreeWeekend! Utilize online options and curbside pickup to stay safe and healthy while getting a head start on back-to-school shopping!  📓✏️👕 https://t.co/dqXFbf5936

Last year I had the honor of presenting PFC Terry Wilson the Purple Heart Medal for his service in Afghanistan.   Today on #NationalPurpleHeartDay let's reflect on the brave men and women who were either wounded in battle or paid the ultimate sacrifice serving our nation. 💜 https://t.co/hqMuu6RkEI

Big thanks to the #HometownHeroes who helped fill the bus with school supplies for Allen Community Outreach which will benefit @Allen_ISD students.  Loved seeing our community especially the @Allen_Police and @Starbucks at Stacy Green come together for a great cause! 🚌✏📚 https://t.co/fgSzufoVDR

Visited @PlanoFireRescue Station 2 where they shared stories from the frontlines. Our first responders are working hard transporting #COVID19 patients & administering tests. From all of us in Collin County thank you for selfless efforts to help us overcome this pandemic. 🚒 https://t.co/MtGFZ3hFe3

I know how important receiving letters from home was to me as a young Marine serving in Iraq. Thanks to Operation Gratitude & Frisco Parks & Rec we can make sure our deployed men & women have a little piece of home to carry with them as they work to protect our great nation. 📬 https://t.co/e514BQRu3p

Regularly checking in on our neighbors is vital during these difficult times. Thankfully we have some local students and #HometownHeroes to help with this. Thank you to COVID Check-In who has donated hundreds of care packages to senior living facilities around our community!🛍 https://t.co/aZb0Xor9bp

The Town of Fairview has faced the devastating consequences of flooding for too long. I'm pleased to see the House pass #WRDA2020 which includes my measure to expedite the resolution of Wilson Creek & Sloan Creek flooding issues. Learn more: https://t.co/waayAH3x5Z https://t.co/0Fb3B1Za2V

DYK one blood donation can save up to three lives? As a result of #COVID19 many blood drives were cancelled resulting in a shortage of blood donations across the nation. Thanks to the American @RedCross & @Tacodeli for hosting safe blood drives in our community to help others. https://t.co/Fhr7wpgLgS

When the going gets tough the tough get going – which is exactly what Allen Community Outreach is doing by offering drive thru food pantry services. As we fight to end hunger I cannot thank ACO enough for all they are doing for Collin County! https://t.co/sdC16GxZSN

Jaxson Turner may be young but he certainly doesn't let that stop him from making a difference in Collin County! Whether he's helping feed the homeless or providing school supplies to kids he's always helping others!   Nominate a #TX03 #HometownHero at https://t.co/k07heeq9fB! https://t.co/OJOr1RWWeG

Fairview residents know the threat flooding poses when heavy rains hit. Excited to have my provisions to better address flooding in the area included in the 2020 Water Resources Development Act (WRDA) and ready to resolve this issue. https://t.co/OaU6hE52FP

John Lewis was a man of historic proportion; a civil rights leader dedicated public servant and a loving father and husband. Today we mourn the loss of a man who inspired so many and celebrate the legacy he leaves behind. https://t.co/RV9dG7zpU6

Visited @BSWhealth this week & was blown away by the treatment & equipment used to aid in the recovery of #COVID19 patients. Thank you to our #CollinCounty #HealthcareHeroes on the frontlines of this pandemic. Your willingness to put patients above yourself is incredible. https://t.co/nJIYXRUMTq

Welcome home to Plano nurse & #TX03 #HometownHero - Rachel Carmichael! Rachel traveled to the frontlines of NYC to provide #COVID19 aid. Thanks to all the nurses and many others who are protecting the health of others above their own. Nominate a hero at https://t.co/k07heeq9fB. https://t.co/bmtywPzD6N

Excited to announce I'm accepting applications for my Congressional Youth Advisory Council. This program provides an incredible opportunity for #TX03 high school students to learn about gov & develop leadership skills. Visit the link below to learn more! https://t.co/QeFfUoBnxZ

Let's say thanks to another #HometownHero here in Plano - Ram Mehta and In Fretta Pizza. When this pandemic started joined by many local partners Ram and his restaurant worked to make sure everyone had free warm meals. Thanks Ram! https://t.co/vqH67c7Dcy

The Paycheck Protection Program’s application deadline is now August 8 2020. With over 6000 Texas-based businesses already receiving loans I encourage Collin County business impacted by the pandemic to visit the link below to apply for #COVID19 relief. https://t.co/GyoZkE2Ep9

Join me in recognizing @vcont2015 as one of our many local #HometownHeroes during these unprecedented times. Thank you for selflessly helping North Texas Veterans cope with the uncertainty of COVID-19.   To nominate a hometown hero you know visit https://t.co/k07heeq9fB. https://t.co/0w19Ikzf0I

This Fourth of July let us take time to reflect on the liberties our forefathers granted us and the brave men and women overseas still protecting those liberties. Wishing everyone a safe #IndependenceDay and may we never take for granted the freedoms of our democracy. https://t.co/CFsTjOfKVz
If you need help finding a #COVID19 testing location or if you are looking for more information to help determine if you should be tested visit the @TexasDSHS website here ➡️ https://t.co/IpG5Deh1q4.

Protecting American workers cultivating economic growth and ensuring freer markets is essential to our economy here in North Texas. As the #USMCA goes into effect Collin County families will see higher wages and increased job opportunities. https://t.co/ipNIM7LeaG

As #PTSDAwarenessMonth comes to an end let's remember PTSD affects 9 million individuals in the U.S. If you or a loved one has struggled with a traumatic event you are not alone. For crisis help visit the link below for resources from @VA_PTSD_Info. https://t.co/EwT1Af4KlD

Honored to announce these outstanding students who will be attending U.S. Service Academies this fall. These young leaders are willing to serve a much greater cause and I'm a proud to see them pursing the call to serve our great nation. https://t.co/4HPwYlxiKI

17 years ago today I came back to Texas with all 28 of my men in good health from our deployment to Iraq. Grateful to fight for the best nation on earth blessed to come home and thankful Anne sent me a letter every single day I was away. Semper Fi! https://t.co/N8HKveiV9R

Our government works best with active participation and last week I enjoyed having the opportunity to engage in a constructive conversation with constituents from @ccldfw to establish bipartisan climate solutions. https://t.co/4VQ7FwnlT5

Below #Dallas businesses can find information on Dallas Forward – an online resource hub for small and medium-sized businesses in Dallas looking for additional financial resources as a result of #COVID19. https://t.co/U8TNwuJfrF

Thanks to the @USChamber for honoring me as a recipient of the 2020 Spirit of Enterprise Award. I'll continue to work across the aisle to ensure local businesses may continue to innovate and create jobs right here in Collin County. https://t.co/JBJmjkxg0p

To help small businesses rebound from the financial impact of #COVID19 @CityofAllenTX announced the Allen Small Business Grants Program. For more information including application and eligibility requirements visit the link below. https://t.co/B7BleA5s31

🚨Attention Frisco Small Businesses🚨  @CityOfFriscoTx has announced the #Frisco Small Business Recovery Grant Program to better assist those who experienced financial hardships due to #COVID19. More information on how to apply can be found below. https://t.co/4btwYiZjuw

It’s important we remain vigilant to reduce the spread of #COVID19. While this is an evolving situation please visit my website for issue-specific alerts for families seniors and veterans as well as @CDCgov recommendations on how to #SlowTheSpread. https://t.co/3pJvuxTg3N

Nearly two & a half years after Lincoln signed the Emancipation Proclamation 250000 slaves in Texas were finally freed on 6/19/1865. Today we honor Juneteenth which serves as a celebration of freedom & an important reminder of the ongoing fight for equality in our nation. https://t.co/VXNWbdaZDx

Tomorrow my offices will be closed to observe Juneteenth & celebrate the long-awaited freedom of Black Americans 155 yrs ago. To recognize the significance of this day I’ve joined fellow Texan @JacksonLeeTX18 in calling for #Juneteenth to be recognized as a federal holiday.
